subtitleNullable: Sustainability, Financing, Infectious Diseases, and Mental Health
descriptionNullable:
_____
# Health Indicators in Sri Lanka
### Sustainability, Financing, Infectious Diseases, and Mental Health
By Humanitarian Data Exchange [[source]](https://data.world/humdata)
_____

### About this dataset
> This dataset contains a comprehensive collection of health indicators for Sri Lanka from the World Health Organization's data portal, covering an array of topics related to mortality and global health estimates, sustainable development goals, Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), health systems and financing, public health and environment, substance use and mental health, tobacco control initiatives, infectious diseases control measures – including HIV/AIDS – as well as mental and sexual reproductive health. Moreover, this dataset further contains indicators related to the service organization and delivery of treatment capacity and treatment coverage in Sri Lanka. All necessary links for individual indicator metadata are included in the resource descriptions. 
> 
> It is important to note that data in this dataset is best viewed as statistical estimates meant to inform decision makers on current trends in public health initiatives. Nevertheless it is essential that due caution be taken when using them due to their potential limitations such as geographical imprecision or outdatedness derived from when they were last updated. The license accompanying this dataset has been provided by Other which can be more FULLY understood by visiting the HUMDATA website link found within this description which also serves as access point for further documentation on how the data was collected through the use of registries used at source level

### More Datasets
> For more datasets, click [here](https://www.kaggle.com/thedevastator/datasets).

### Featured Notebooks
> - 🚨 **Your notebook can be here!** 🚨! 

### How to use the dataset
> The health indicators dataset for Sri Lanka provides important data on various areas, ranging from mortality and global health estimates to service organization and delivery of treatment capacity. This dataset is a great resource for analyzing the health status of Sri Lankan citizens and understanding some of the underlying drivers. 
> 
> This guide outlines how to use this dataset, including a quick overview of what’s included, how to access the data, and an explanation about the columns in the dataset. 
> 
> ##### What's Included? 
> The Health Indicators for Sri Lanka dataset includes 68 indicators from a range of categories such as mortality rates, disease prevalence rates, treatment coverage rates, pharmaceutical drug spending and more. The region column in the metadata specifies which area within Sri Lanka each indicator is measured against (e.g., national level). The country column states that all values correspond to information related to Sri Lanka only. In addition to numerical values like percentages or counts per million people (M), you will also find categorical information such as sex or types of drugs available at a certain facility/location in your query results.  
> 
> 
> ##### Accessing Data 
> 
> 
> ##### Understanding Metadata Columns: 					       
> The metadata columns include codes used by data publishers along with description fields which help provide context for understanding analytical findings based off analysis conducted using this datasets: GHO CODE – Global Health Observatory code; ENDYEAR – Year when data was collected ; COUNTRY CODE – Country Code 'CL' identifies Country name -SriLanka; SEX DISPLAY – Gender measured (e g male female); NUMERIC VALUE – numbers indicating counts per million people M ; GhO DISPLAY–name associated with Gho code ; PUBLISHSTATE CODE–code used by publisher designates publication status; PUBLISHSTATE DISPLAY -name associated with publishstate code ;PUBLIC STATE URL location where additional info found

### Research Ideas
> - Mapping Sri Lanka's health infrastructure and visualizing the distribution of health resources across the country.
> - Analyzing the trends in health indicators for different demographic groups to identify correlations between risk factors and public health outcomes in Sri Lanka.
> - Creating predictive models to forecast how changes in countries policies or advances in medical technology might impact public health outcomes in Sri Lanka over a period of time

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> [Data Source](https://data.world/humdata)
> 
>


### License
> 
> 
> See the dataset description for more information.

### Columns

**File: quickcharts-indicators-for-sri-lanka-1.csv**
| Column name        | Description                                                    |
|:-------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------|
| **GHO (CODE)**     | The Global Health Observatory code for the indicator. (String) |
| **ENDYEAR**        | The year the data was collected. (Integer)                     |
| **COUNTRY (CODE)** | The country code for Sri Lanka. (String)                       |
| **SEX (DISPLAY)**  | The gender of the data subject. (String)                       |
| **Numeric**        | The numerical value of the indicator. (Float)                  |

_____

**File: rsud-service-organization-and-delivery-treatment-capacity-and-treatment-coverage-indicators-for-sri--47.csv**
| Column name                                | Description                                                            |
|:-------------------------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **GHO (CODE)**                             | The Global Health Observatory code for the indicator. (String)         |
| **COUNTRY (CODE)**                         | The country code for Sri Lanka. (String)                               |
| **ENDYEAR**                                | The year the data was collected. (Integer)                             |
| **Numeric**                                | The numerical value of the indicator. (Float)                          |
| **GHO (DISPLAY)**                          | The Global Health Observatory display name for the indicator. (String) |
| **GHO (URL)**                              | The URL for the Global Health Observatory indicator. (String)          |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (CODE)**                    | The code for the publication status of the indicator. (String)         |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (DISPLAY)**                 | The display name for the publication status of the indicator. (String) |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (URL)**                     | The URL for the publication status of the indicator. (String)          |
| **YEAR (CODE)**                            | The code for the year the data was collected. (Integer)                |
| **YEAR (DISPLAY)**                         | The display name for the year the data was collected. (String)         |
| **YEAR (URL)**                             | The URL for the year the data was collected. (String)                  |
| **REGION (CODE)**                          | The code for the region the data was collected from. (String)          |
| **REGION (DISPLAY)**                       | The display name for the region the data was collected from. (String)  |
| **REGION (URL)**                           | The URL for the region the data was collected from. (String)           |
| **STARTYEAR**                              | The start year of the data collection. (Integer)                       |
| **COUNTRY (DISPLAY)**                      | The display name for the country the data was collected from. (String) |
| **COUNTRY (URL)**                          | The URL for the country the data was collected from. (String)          |
| **RSUDMAINSUBSTANCEATTREATMENT (CODE)**    | The code for the main substance at treatment. (String)                 |
| **RSUDMAINSUBSTANCEATTREATMENT (DISPLAY)** | The display name for the main substance at treatment. (String)         |
| **RSUDMAINSUBSTANCEATTREATMENT (URL)**     | The URL for the main substance at treatment. (String)                  |
| **RSUDSUBSTANCEDEPENDENCE (CODE)**         | The code for the substance dependence. (String)                        |
| **RSUDSUBSTANCEDEPENDENCE (DISPLAY)**      | The display name for the substance dependence. (String)                |
| **RSUDSUBSTANCEDEPENDENCE (URL)**          | The URL for the substance dependence. (String)                         |
| **Display Value**                          | The numerical value of the indicator. (Float)                          |
| **Low**                                    | The lower bound of the indicator. (Float)                              |
| **High**                                   | The upper bound of the indicator. (Float)                              |
| **StdErr**                                 | The standard error of the indicator. (Float)                           |
| **StdDev**                                 | The standard deviation of the indicator. (Float)                       |
| **Comments**                               | Any additional comments about the indicator. (String)                  |

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit [Humanitarian Data Exchange](https://data.world/humdata).
